oracle.mapviewer.share.mapcache
Class TileDefinition

java.lang.Object
  oracle.mapviewer.share.mapcache.TileDefinition

public class TileDefinition
extends java.lang.Object

A TileDefinition object describes a map image tile managed by a map cache server.
A map image tile is specified by its zoom level, bounding box, size and image format.
The following image formats are supported:

  • GIF - TileDefinition.FORMAT_GIF
  • PNG - TileDefinition.FORMAT_PNG
  • JPEG - TileDefinition.FORMAT_JPEG

Constant Field Values

CUSTOM_TEXT_PREFIX

public static final java.lang.String CUSTOM_TEXT_PREFIX
Custom text prefix string. The result map tile will be rendered as a blank tile with custom text string drawn on it, if the map tile URL returned by MapSourceAdapter.getMapTileRequest starts with this prefix string. Custom text string is defined as follows. ?&?$style:t.street$text:Map is not available at this area.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

TileDefinition

public TileDefinition(int zoomLevel,
                      double scale,
                      java.lang.String zoomLevelName,
                      java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D bbox,
                      long meshX,
                      long meshY,
                      int imageWidth,
                      int imageHeight,
                      int format,
                      java.lang.String serverURL,
                      java.lang.String proxyHost,
                      java.lang.String proxyPort)
Creates a TileDefinition object using the given parameters.

Parameters:
zoomLevel - the zoom level on which the tile is defined.
zoomLevelName - the name of the zoom level on which the tile is defined.
bbox - the bounding box of the tile defined in the map data coordinate system.
imageWidth - the width of the tile image.
imageHeight - the height of the tile image.
format - the tile image format.
serverURL - the URL of the external server from which the map tile is fetched
proxyHost - the host name of the proxy server through which the external map tile is fetched
proxyPort - the port number of the proxy server through which the external map tile is fetched
